channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bench to be removed, 20th July
item.description:
There is a bench outside no. 21 Galahad Road, br1 5dt. The bench is causing anti social behaviour from screaming kids sitting on it everyday screaming and bouncing their footballs. This happens everyday and cannot open the windows through the noise, The branch needs removing as only they use it. This is the second time I am reporting this, please .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Galahad Road, Downham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree Planting Request, 20th July
item.description:
This area is disused and would be a great place for trees to be planted, to enhance the natural beauty of the area, create shade and habitats for local wildlife. It is an eye sore, and I walk past it everyday and think of how trees can transform spaces for the better!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Mead Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: Gas canisters, 20th July
item.description:
Two boxes of large gas canisters dumped outside my garage. I live at 331 long lane and my garage is at the end of my property. The garage entrance is actually in Kipling road .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kipling Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Filthy rubbish dump on pavement, 20th July
item.description:
It is not the council that dumps rubbish on the pavement but the council has caused this filthy dump. You removed black bins from Dorset Sq and Bryanston Sq, so attracting all rubbish to these 2 black bins. You have refused to consider a medium to longer term solution to this rubbish dump. Residents who live near this dump should cut our Council tax payments to compensate for living next to filth.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, York Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Empty containers and food waste, 20th July
item.description:
As usual, empty containers, plastic bags, food waste etc spread across County Street from the nearby Lebanese Grill. Note that foxes feast on leftover food and exacerbate the issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74-75, County Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Abandoned and un-emptied recycling bin, 20th July
item.description:
This bin has been left on the corner of Ladas Rd and Linton Grove for several months. It has gradually become filled and is starting to smell and has never emptied by the recycling team. It should be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Ladas Road, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree impeding the path, 20th July
item.description:
